intro: Monnina hirtella, commonly known as prairie bluestem, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Monnina hirtella is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
